subclusters.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
Telomere-Associated Oxidative Stress and Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on superoxide dismutase activity and antioxidant defense modulating oxidative damage to proteins and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes catalase overexpression reducing protein oxidative damage and improving function, highlighting antioxidant enzyme roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes balance between ROS production and antioxidant/repair systems affecting protein oxidation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS and protein oxidation levels to lifespan differences, focusing on antioxidant defense and biomolecular sensitivity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows oxidative protein damage in brain regions correlates with aging and is modulated by caloric restriction affecting antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced protein oxidation in C. elegans and genetic modulation of antioxidant defenses affecting lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights thioredoxin antioxidant system's role in modulating oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative protein damage, and antioxidant defense systems influencing aging in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes an optimum superoxide level regulated by Mn SOD affecting oxidative damage and lifespan, emphasizing antioxidant enzyme balance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Examines effects of Cu,Zn-SOD overexpression on oxidative damage and lifespan, focusing on antioxidant enzyme roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Defense and Protein Oxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Tests SOD mimetics effects on oxidative damage and aging, emphasizing antioxidant enzyme modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic co-regulation of antioxidant enzymes (oxy-regulon) controlling oxidative stress defenses and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Imbalance and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how imbalance in SOD and glutathione peroxidase activities leads to H2O2-mediated cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Superoxide Dismutase and Vascular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extracellular SOD decline causing vascular oxidative stress and endothelial dysfunction during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Oxidative Stress and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress causing telomere erosion, chondrocyte senescence, and cartilage aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Oxidative Stress and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress accelerating telomere shortening and its impact on biological aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Oxidative Stress and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows oxidative stress in oocytes causes premature loss of meiotic cohesion, linking oxidative damage to chromosomal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Oxidative Stress-Induced Transcriptional Fidelity Loss Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced RNA-DNA differences and genomic entropy impairing transcriptional fidelity and accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Life-History Trade-Off with Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress resistance genetically to reproduction-longevity trade-offs and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Comparative Oxidative Damage and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Examines ROS damage and antioxidant defenses in long-lived mammals, challenging simple oxidative damage-longevity correlations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced PI3K/AKT/mTOR Pathway Activation and Accelerated Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress activating PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling causing stem cell depletion, senescence, and accelerated aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Signaling in Stem Cell Function and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS as signaling molecules regulating stem cell fate and aging via redox-sensitive pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Mitochondrial ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes low-level mitochondrial ROS induce adaptive stress responses promoting longevity via mitohormesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage that increases proton leak and ROS production, accelerated by aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress in Brain Aging and Alzheimer's Disease Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction to brain aging, AD pathology, and systemic frailty.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Redox Signaling in Age-Related Degeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS causing cellular damage and apoptosis with dual signaling/damage roles in aging and osteoporosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Signaling and Oxidative Stress in Cognitive Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes redox signaling disruption by H2O2 affecting neuronal function and cognitive decline beyond oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Brain Region-Specific Oxidative Protein Damage and Functional Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links region-specific oxidative protein damage in brain to independent cognitive and motor aging declines.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: MAO-B Mediated Oxidative Stress and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related MAO-B increase producing H2O2 causing neuronal oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Activation-Induced Oxidative Stress and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative costs of innate immune activation increasing ROS and impairing antioxidant defenses with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Glycation and Free Radical Chain Reaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on advanced glycation end products formation coupled with oxidative stress and free radical propagation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Modification and Vascular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes oxidative damage to vascular components drives cardiovascular aging and age-related diseases.
